name: lang/dynamic-rules
description:
A revised version of the pre-0.9.5 dynamic-rules-tools
Now using the new hash-tables, and implementing scoping
as a 'stack' of hashtables.

issues: - a break inside the do-while
- propagation in the first run could be wrong
or if rulename + scoping of DR_BREAK suffices
are merged, one of them is lost and not discarded. This needs
to be fixed (unless the garbage collector takes care of this)

strategies.name: dr-rule-sets-hashtable
strategies.description: Retrieve the primitive dynamic rules hashtable.

strategies.name: dr-scope-all(s)
strategies.description:
Scope all dynamic rules.

this strategy also scopes the config hashtable.
notes: While get-config and set-config do not actually use dynamic rules,

strategies.name: dr-scope-all-start
strategies.description:
Start a new scope for all dynamic rules.

this strategy also scopes the config hashtable.
notes: While get-config and set-config do not actually use dynamic rules,

strategies.name: dr-scope-all-end
strategies.description: End a scope for all dynamic rules.

strategies.name: dr-get-scope-labels( | name)
strategies.description: Get all scope labels ordered from inner, most recent, to outer, oldest.

strategies.name: dr-get-first-scope-label(s | name)
strategies.description:
Get the first scope label for which s succeeds starting with the
inner, most recent, scope.

strategies.name: dr-ignore-state(s | name)
strategies.description: Apply s in a state where the current dynamic rules for name are ignored.

strategies.name: dr-ignore-states(s | names)
strategies.description: Apply s in a state where the current dynamic rules for names are ignored.

strategies.name: dr-intersect-with( | name)
strategies.description: Intersect live rule-set with given rule set changing the live rule set.

strategies.name: dr-intersect-symm( | name)
strategies.description: Intersect live rule-set with given rule set changing both.

strategies.name: dr-union-with( | name)
strategies.description: Merge live rule-set with given rule set using union changing the live rule set.

strategies.name: dr-union-symm( | name)
strategies.description: Merge live rule-set with give rule set using union changing both.

strategies.name: dr-left-choice(s1, s2 | rulenames)
strategies.description: Left choice with dynamic rule roll-back in case s1 fails.

strategies.name: dr-get-first-scope-label(s)
strategies.description: Get the first scope label for which s succeeds.

strategies.name: dr-commit-change-set(destroy)
strategies.description:
The strategy destroy indicates whether the change
set should also be destroyed after the commmit.

strategies.name: dr-apply-change( | tbl)
strategies.description:
commit to ruleset is finding the first ChangeSet (any) *or* the first
RuleScope that has the appropriate scopeid (i.e. hashtable pointer)
and setting the key-value into it

strategies.name: dr-apply-removal
strategies.description:
the old implementation (for reference)


dr-commit-to-rule-set(|scpid, key, value) =
fetch(
dr-commit-to-change-set(|scpid, key, value)
+ dr-commit-to-rule-scope(|scpid, key, value))

dr-commit-to-change-set(|scpid, key, value) =
?ChangeSet(_, _, tbl)
; where(<hashtable-put(|(scpid, key), value)> tbl)

dr-commit-to-rule-scope(|scpid, key, value) =
?RuleScope(_,tbl@Hashtable(scpid))
; where(<hashtable-put(|key, value)> tbl)

strategies.name: dr-lookup-rule( | key)
strategies.description: Fetch the most recent definition for key.

strategies.name: dr-lookup-rule-in-scope( | key, scpid)
strategies.description:
Version of dr-lookup-rule that looks for definition of a key
in a particular scope. The expected scope id (scpid) is the
pointer to the hashtable of a rule scope and is usually
identified by means of a label, i.e., a label indicates the
rule scope and the rule scope has a unique scope id.

strategies.name: dr-lookup-rule-pointer( | key)
strategies.description:
Fetch the most recent definition for key and return a pointer
to the table that defines it.

strategies.name: dr-all-keys( | removed, result)
strategies.description: Fetch all keys defined in a rule set.

strategies.name: dr-set-in-rule-set( | key, value)
strategies.description:
set a rule in the inner scope

The inner scope has label () since all scopes are labeled
this way.

strategies.name: dr-set-in-rule-set( | label, key, value)
strategies.description: set a rule in the scope with specified label

strategies.name: dr-set-in-rule-set(set: ATerm * Hashtable * ATerm * ATerm * ATerm -> ATerm | label, key, value)
dr-set-in-rule-set(set1: ATerm * Hashtable * ATerm * ATerm * ATerm -> ATerm | label, key, value)
dr-set-in-rule-set-vis( | key, value)
strategies.description:
Add a rule to the rule-set with the specified label and make sure
it is visible by deleting any rules with the same key in scopes
upto the specified scope. Deleting by removing from the table, not
undefining.

strategies.name: dr-set-in-rule-set-vis(set: ATerm * Hashtable * ATerm * ATerm * ATerm -> ATerm, rm: ATerm * Hashtable * ATerm * ATerm -> ATerm | label, key, value)
dr-set-in-rule-set-vis(set1: ATerm * Hashtable * ATerm * ATerm * ATerm -> ATerm, rm1: ATerm * Hashtable * ATerm * ATerm -> ATerm | label, key, value)
dr-add-to-rule-set( | label, key, value)
strategies.description:
add a rule to the scope for label

= set-rule(|l, k, [v | <lookup-rule(|l, k, v) <+ ![]>])

strategies.name: dr-add-to-rule-set(add: ATerm * Hashtable * ATerm * ATerm * ATerm -> ATerm | label, key, value)
dr-add-to-rule-set(add1: ATerm * Hashtable * ATerm * ATerm * ATerm -> ATerm | label, key, value)
dr-add-to-rule-set-vis( | label, key, value)
strategies.description:
add a rule to the scope for label such that it is visible afterwards

= set-rule(|l, k, [v | <lookup-rule(|l, k, v) <+ ![]>])

strategies.name: dr-add-to-rule-set-vis(add: ATerm * Hashtable * ATerm * ATerm * ATerm -> ATerm, rm: ATerm * Hashtable * ATerm * ATerm -> ATerm | label, key, value)
dr-add-to-rule-set-vis(add1: ATerm * Hashtable * ATerm * ATerm * ATerm -> ATerm, rm1: ATerm * Hashtable * ATerm * ATerm -> ATerm | label, key, value)
dr-merge-rule-sets(merge-rs, merge-cs)
strategies.description: Merge two rule sets scope by scope.

strategies.name: dr-fix-change-set
strategies.description:
Fixes references in change set that point to rule scopes that will
no longer be part of the merged ruleset. It is assumed that the references
that point to rule scopes in rsbad have to be replaced with references to
the corresponding (according to position) rule scopes in rsgood.

No longer used.

strategies.name: dr-intersect-rule-sets
strategies.description:
Intersection of two rule-sets

assumption: the scope structure is the same
intersection works scope by scope
note that labels are ignored

strategies.name: dr-intersect-rule-sets-symm
strategies.description:
Symmetric intersection of two rule-sets

assumption: the scope structure is the same
intersection works scope by scope
note that labels are ignored

strategies.name: dr-union-rule-sets
strategies.description:
Union of two rule-sets

assumption: the scope structure of the two rule-sets is the same
and union works scope by scope

strategies.name: dr-fork-and-merge(merge1, merge2, s1, s2 | rulenames1, rulenames2)
dr-break-bp( | rulename)
strategies.description:
This implementation of the strategy doesn't work.
(left here for reference purposes only)

Reason: replacing a number of change sets & rule scopes with
their clones introduces inconsistency issues during merging
that are way too difficult to solve.


dr-break-bp(|rulename) =
where(
<DR_BREAK>Label(rulename) => label
; dr-get-rule-set(|rulename)
; back-split-at(|<DR_BREAK>SplitPos(rulename, label))
; ?(inRs, outRs)
; <map({scope, lbls :
(?ChangeSet(_, _, _); dr-new-change-set)
<+ \ RuleScope(labels, table) -> scope
where dr-new-scope => scope@RuleScope(lbls, tbl)
; <iset-addlist(|<iset-elements>labels)>lbls
; <hashtable-keys>table
; map({key, val :
?key
; <hashtable-get(|key)>table => val
; <hashtable-put(|key, val)>tbl
}) \
})>inRs
; <conc>(<id>, outRs)
; dr-set-rule-set(|rulename)
)

strategies.name: dr-build-aggregated-change-set
strategies.description:
This strategy takes a pair of lists of change sets and rule scopes
and returns a change set which contains all the changes from the
change sets in the left member of the input pair which refer to
rule scopes in the right member of the input pair.

strategies.name: dr-fork-and-union(s1, s2 | rulenames)
strategies.description: Fork and union of two rule-sets

strategies.name: dr-fork-and-intersect-union(s1, s2 | rulenames1, rulenames2)
strategies.description: Fork and combined union and intersection of two rule-sets

strategies.name: dr-fix-and-intersect-union(s | rulenames1, rulenames2)
strategies.description: Iterate combined union and intersection of two rule-sets

strategies.name: dr-label-union(s | rulenames, label)
strategies.description:
Label current point in data-flow with <label> to accommodate
break's. Union of rule-sets after running <s>:
- the "main" rule-set resulted by running <s>
- all the rule-sets generated by calls to dr-break
with the same label as this one

!! Only use this to label non-iterative statements. !!
!! Use dr-fix-and-union which takes a label         !!
!! argument to label iterative statements.          !!

strategies.name: dr-fold-and-intersect(empty, hd, tl: a -> a * a -> a | rulenames)
dr-fold-and-intersect(empty, hd, tl: a -> a * a -> a | rulenames, rs0)
dr-map-and-intersect(s | rulenames)
strategies.description: fork and intersect over a list
